content: here's an easy piece that can help add some height to your encounters
nothing like a short easy craft to unwind after a hard day's work you're
going to need this piece in the next episode so I went to my spare parts bin
where I toss all my small extras and leftovers from previous projects and
found a bunch of wooden planks prepared using curved fins method as described
back in episode 7 and I found some standard and jumbo sized popsicle sticks
so first I took five full-length sticks and chopped off the rounded ends then
line them up and turn them over and hot glue to scrap pieces across them to bind
them all together easy then I took three segments and cut them
to be as long as the platform is wide as you see here and again turn them over
and bind them together with any kind of scrap material
then we get some kebab skewers and cut four posts that are 2 inches long hot
glue them to the bottom of the main platform as shown and then take some
more skewer lengths and connect the legs together on three of the four sides
these connecting pieces don't need to be parallel and in fact you might
deliberately attach them skewed like I did to give sort of a crude look now we
do the exact same thing with a smaller platform again two inch long posts and I
only attached one cross brace on the long side then some dabs of hot glue on
all four legs and attach it to one side of the main platform make sure that a
miniature could be moved underneath the small platform so place your cross
braces on the outer most side then I took a segment of a jumbo stick and cut
it so that there's a little room at the bottom for a miniature and hot glue it
on as a ramp to the upper platform for the lower platform I didn't have any
jumbo sticks left that were long enough so I just attach two of them together
kind of offset as you see here now don't attach this to the platform's that would
make this piece bigger than it needs to be in terms of storage instead keep it
separate and just place it on when you're using it like this and now you
can populate this thing with crates bags chests whatever containers you want and
the piece create some interesting combat possibilities you've got high ground to
consider you'll notice that the upper platform can only fit two medium sized
creatures maybe someone is standing below it and they enjoy some kind of
cover or the entire thing falls over at a crucial moment sometimes that's how I
like to do my session planning I get gameplay ideas that are spawned from the
terrain itself instead of the other way around where you imagine something and
then build scenery to match it and here it is in context just a sneak peek for
the next episode I am wile Locke thank you for joining me and I'll see you next
time you
